intro: Mandevilla stephanotidifolia, commonly known as the flame vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its vigorous growth and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of bright orange to red blooms, which are typically 3 to 5 inches long. It thrives in warm climates and is often cultivated as a decorative vine due to its ornamental value. Mandevilla stephanotidifolia prefers full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners in tropical and subtropical regions.
